Package com.zentri.zentri_ble_command

zentri_ble_command allows an application to execute ZentriOS BLE commands remotely.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BLECallbacks
    Callback functions for zentri_ble_command.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Result
    Result of executing a remote ZentriOS BLE command
    ZentriOSBLEManager
    Main Interface for controlling a ZentriOS BLE device.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    BaudRate
    UART baud rates supported by ZentriOS BLE
    BusInitMode
    The device will enter this mode on reboot.
    Command
    Commands supported by ZentriOS BLE.
    CommandMode
    Sets response format to human for readable output (ie serial terminal) or machine for easier parsing by applications.
    ErrorCode
    Error codes reported from ZentriOSBLEManager.
    GPIODirection
    GPIO direction of a pin configured to the stdio function.
    GPIOFunction
    GPIO functions, for details see the ZentriOS BLE wiki.
    PrintLevel
    Print level of command system.
    ReceiveMode
    Controls how received data is interpreted and returned to the application.
    SerialControl
    Determines how the serial bus is switched between STREAM mode and COMMAND mode.

Package com.zentri.zentri_ble_command Description

zentri_ble_command allows an application to execute ZentriOS BLE commands remotely. The library is one part of the ZentriOS BLE Android library set.

NOTE This library is designed to work with zentri_ble to manage the low level BLE operations.

There are demo applications available to show how these libraries should be used to build your application. Contact Zentri at www.zentri.com for the source to these applications.

zentri_ble_command handles the following:

  • Running commands on a remote ZentriOS BLE device (over BLE) and returning results
  • Sending and receiving data in stream mode
  • Changing ZentriOS BLE modes remotely

To use this library, the application must provide a callback object that implements the ZentriOSCallbacks interface. All results and events are communicated to an application through these callbacks.
